title: CPDCL snaps power supply to Kanaka Durga temple in Vijayawada citing non-payment of ‚Çπ3.08 crore dues

title: Improving organ donor risk mapping and traceability
content: With over three lakh animal bites annually, human rabies has been an escalating public health challenge in Kerala in recent years. This sparks conversations about risk of donor-derived infections that evade routine screening and the adequacy of current organ donor screening protocols

title: BJP sets history by capturing power in two panchayats in Palakkad
content: BJP retains control of the Palakkad municipality for a third consecutive term. The party wrests power from LDF by securing 10 seats in the 19-member Akathethara panchayat, and winning eight of the 14 wards in Pudur.

title: Alliance talks between NCP(SP) and NCP for Pune civic polls hit dead end
content: Elections to 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including Mumbai and Pune, will be held on January 15. The last date to file the nominations is December 30

title: 10.56 lakh names deleted as EC releases Assam's draft electoral rolls after Special Revision
content: Assam has a total of 31,486 polling stations following rationalisation, according to the integrated draft rolls released by ECI

title: 2025 was an eventful year for Kerala
content: Kerala made national headlines during this period by becoming a fully digitally literate State and the first State in the country to be free from extreme poverty

title: Merger of civilian enclaves in Secunderabad Cantonment with expanded GHMC remains unfinished
content: The Secunderabad Cantonment spans around 10,000 acres and is divided into land seven categories; of this lands covering about 5,670 acres are owned by the Indian Army and lands spread over 2,676 acres are privately owned by residents

title: Kochi metro and water metro to operate additional services on New Year‚Äôs Eve

content: The Raiders informed defensive end Maxx Crosby that he will sit out against the Giants because of a knee injury. After being told of the decision, Crosby left the team's facility.

content: Lakers guard Austin Reaves is expected to miss at least a month because of a calf strain, the team announced.

content: Defensive end Myles Garrett says it would be "special" to set the NFL's single-season sack record against "legendary" quarterback Aaron Rodgers when the Browns and Steelers square off Sunday in Cleveland.

content: The Patriots will be without five starters against the Jets, but there's still a chance rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson is available as he progresses through concussion protocol.

content: The Texans can clinch a playoff spot against the Chargers, while the Ravens need a win against the Packers. Here are the odds, game picks, prop plays and daily fantasy tips for the games.

content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

content: Man United's win over Newcastle on Boxing Day may be Ruben Amorim's most satisfying yet as they overcame a depleted squad.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Burrow gifts offensive linemen authentic dinosaur, bear and mammoth fossils for Christmas
content: Burrow's love of fossils gained national acclaim because of a clip from the Netflix series "Quarterback," where he was pumped to see fossils at Chicago's Field Museum.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United consider re-signing former midfielder Garner
content: Former Manchester United midfielder James Garner is being targeted for a return to Old Trafford. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How U.S. Soccer can grow the game with $100 million World Cup windfall
content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?

title: Colton Herta's adaptation to F2 could define IndyCar's global reputation
content: Colton Herta left IndyCar for F2 in hopes of moving up to F1. Whether he succeeds could determine how the world views the American open-wheel series.

title: Asim Munir Speaks Of 'Brain Gain', Pakistan Sees Mass Exodus Of Skilled Workers
content: Pakistan is facing a severe "brain drain" as a result of economic and political instability and limited opportunities, and thousands of doctors, engineers, and accountants have left the country over the past 2 years for work overseas.

title: Delivery Workers' Strike: Survey Highlights Low Wages, Other Challenges
content: Delivery workers are nothing short of a godsend for many in India's cities. They zip through heavy traffic, pollution, and harsh weather to bring hot food and groceries to consumers. But behind the wheel, they fight a silent battle for survival.

title: 'They Killed Him Over His Job': Bangladeshi Hindu Man's Family To NDTV
content: When he was alive, a rectangular structure of tin sheets in a village 140 km from Bangladesh's capital Dhaka was what Dipu Chandra Das called home. It took NDTV's Ankit Tyagi nearly four hours to cover this distance in heavy traffic.

title: "Attack On Right To Work": M Kharge Calls For 'Save MGNREGA' Campaign
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said a nationwide campaign should be launched against the repeal of rural employment scheme MGNREGA, similar to the pushback against the three farm laws the government was eventually forced to withdraw

title: 2 Men Force 13-Year-Old To Drink Alcohol, Then Rape Her In Delhi
content: Two men, including a bank employee, have been arrested for raping a 13-year-old girl after forcing her to drink alcohol in Delhi

title: 15-Year-Old Girl Dies By Suicide At Home, Family Claims Harassment At School
content: The father of a 15-year-old schoolgirl in Uttar Pradesh has blamed the school administration and two teachers for his daughter's suicide, alleging constant "mental harassment and public humiliation."

title: Suspicious Bag On J&K Highway Destroyed By Security Forces
content: A suspicious bag found on the Srinagar-Baramulla National Highway in Jammu and Kashmir was destroyed by security forces as a precautionary measure, amid heightened alert ahead of the New Year.

title: Suspended Andhra Professor's Body Found Inside Parked Car
content: The body of a suspended professor was found inside a locked car in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati in a decomposed state.

title: "Rahul Gandhi, Look At Congress": Behind Digvijaya Singh's Call For Reforms
content: The Congress has been left red-faced yet again after a senior leader openly raised the need for reforms within the party.

title: Argument Over Football Match Leads Florida Man To Kill Wife, Die By Suicide
content: A Florida man killed his wife and critically injured his 13-year-old stepdaughter before taking his own life after an argument over watching "Monday Night Football."

title: Actor Allu Arjun Named In 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Chargesheet
content: On December 4, 2024, at Sandhya Theatre in RTC X Roads, Hyderabad, a massive crowd had gathered during the premier screening to catch a glimpse of Allu Arjun, leading to a stampede.

title: Congress Leaders Quit, Tie Up With BJP To Take Control Of Kerala Panchayat
content: In a major political twist in the Mattathur panchayat in Kerala's Thrissur district, all eight Congress members resigned en masse and joined hands with the BJP to take control of the council.

title: 'Not Party's Opinion': Congress Leader On Shashi Tharoor's Praise For PM
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has once again stirred controversy within the party after reportedly saying that rejoicing at the PM's defeat is akin to celebrating India's defeat.

title: "Frustration, Not Leadership": KTR On Revanth Reddy's Silence On KCR's Questions
content: KT Rama Rao came down heavily on Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy for what he termed as his "repeated use of abusive, uncivilised and irresponsible language" and for making derogatory remarks against K Chandrashekhar Rao.

title: Tarique Rahman Registers As Bangladeshi Voter After 17 Years In Exile
content: BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman on Saturday completed the formalities to enlist himself on Bangladesh's voter list and obtain a national identity (NID) card, two days after his return from over 17 years of self-exile in London.

title: On Camera, Woman Rider Harassed By Men On Scooter In Bengaluru
content: A disturbing incident has emerged from Bengaluru, where three men riding on a scooter harassed a woman who was also riding a scooter. The incident happened late Tuesday in the city's Silk Board route.

title: Scolded Over Watching Cartoons, Himachal Girl, 7, Leaves Home: Cops
content: What started as a typical scolding by a mother over watching cartoons, quickly escalated into a tense search for a seven-year-old girl in Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur.

title: Row Over Digvijaya Singh's Post, "Will Rahul Gandhi Show Courage?" Asks BJP
content: Senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh has courted a fresh controversy with his praises for the BJP and its ideological parent, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).

title: Ajit Pawar's NCP Preparing To Contest 60 Seats In Mumbai, Says May Go Solo
content: While talks over a possible reunion of the two factions of the Nationalist Congress Party in Pune have been postponed for now, the Ajit Pawar unit has begun preparations to contest the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections independently.

title: Trinamool MP Says Sons Summoned For Poll Roll Revision Hearing
content: The Election Commission of India has summoned two sons of four-time Trinamool Congress MP and currently the party's Chief Whip in Lok Sabha, Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar, for a hearing on claims and objections to the draft voters' list.

title: 'Save us, open borders': Hindus send SOS from B'desh; attacks on minorities rising
content: Hindus in Bangladesh are pleading with India to open its borders, fearing escalating violence and persecution following recent lynchings.  Concerns are heightened by the potential return of a hardline BNP leader, with minorities feeling trapped and vulnerable.  Activists criticize Indian Hindu organizations for inaction, warning of a potential 'holocaust' if borders remain closed.

title: 'IO colluded with ...': Unnao rape survivor's explosive charge; meets CBI officials
content: Unnao rape victim alleges the investigating officer colluded with the judge, aiming to break her spirit and halt her pursuit of justice. This accusation follows the Delhi High Court's decision to grant bail to convict Kuldeep Singh Sengar, suspending his life sentence.

title: 'Santa reached police station': AAP flags Christmas 'violence, intimidation'; FIR lodged
content: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj highlighted incidents of violence and intimidation against Christmas celebrations nationwide, with Santa Claus reportedly filing an FIR against 'Right Wing goons'. Opposition parties criticized the BJP over alleged disruptions and attacks on Christian communities in states like Madhya Pradesh, Kerala, and Chhattisgarh.

title: Message for Cong? Digvijaya shares old photo of Modi at RSS event - what he said
content: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh praised the RSS's organizational strength, highlighting how grassroots workers rise to leadership. He later clarified his support for 'sangathan' (organization) but remained opposed to the RSS and Prime Minister Modi. Singh also urged Rahul Gandhi to implement internal reforms within the Congress, drawing parallels with his push for Election Commission reforms.

title: Revealed: Kohli, Rohit's per-match earnings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's participation in the Vijay Hazare Trophy highlights the tournament's crucial role in India's domestic cricket.  Player earnings are tiered by experience, not stardom, with seasoned cricketers like Kohli and Sharma earning Rs 60,000 per match, a fraction of their international fees.  Daily allowances and performance-based awards supplement this income.

title: AI rewrites coding norms: Ex-Tesla AI director warns programmers are falling behind; sparks debate
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: Steve Smith scripts history, now second only to Don Bradman in this list
content: Steve Smith has become Australia's second highest run-scorer against England in Ashes history. He surpassed Allan Border during the recent Test match. Smith's consistent performance over many Ashes contests places him in elite company. The match itself was a low-scoring affair dominated by bowlers on a challenging pitch. England ultimately secured a victory in a closely fought contest.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: Between two Indias: Life on the 2025 feed
content: In 2025, the Indian "scroll" is a journey through two worlds on one screen: a filtered India of aesthetic luxury and a raw India of everyday labor. As affordable data and smartphones bring 500 million users online‚Äîmostly from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities‚Äîthe distance between these lives has collapsed.

title: 'Hate for Dalit': BJP attacks Cong over Kharge's treatment in presser - watch video
content: The BJP has accused the Gandhi-Vadra family of open hatred towards Dalits, citing an incident where Jairam Ramesh allegedly directed Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge to read a note aloud. This comes as Congress announced nationwide protests against the alleged replacement of MGNREGA with the 'VB G Ram G Act', which they deem an insult to Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Skywatching in 2026 with eclipses, supermoons, meteor showers and Artemis II
content: Get ready for a celestial spectacle in 2026! Witness a 'ring of fire' solar eclipse, a deep red lunar eclipse, and a rare Blue Moon.  The year culminates with a spectacular total solar eclipse paired with the Perseid meteor shower, plus a supermoon on Christmas Eve. Don't miss NASA's Artemis II lunar mission!

title: Intel CEOs meeting with Trump: Lip-Bu Tan called 2 tech CEOs to vouch for him; govt deals followed
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan faced pressure from President Donald Trump over China investments. Tan sought help from tech leaders Satya Nadella and Jensen Huang. This led to a crucial meeting where Tan secured an $8.9 billion US government investment. The deal gave Intel a vital status. This transformed presidential hostility into a significant government partnership.

title: 'Ball was just sitting in grass': Smith explains why no batter could settle on MCG deck
content: "It probably started quite slow and it's hard to explain. Not tennis bally normally, that's from like the moisture of the wicket," Smith said during the post-match press conference. He added that the thickness of the grass affected how the ball behaved after pitching.

title: DSSSB exams postponed as Delhi considers raising age limit for teacher recruitment posts
content: The Delhi government has postponed the DSSSB examinations scheduled for March as it reviews demands to raise the maximum age limit for candidates. The decision follows protests by aspirants who missed earlier exams due to age restrictions caused by delayed recruitment. Education Minister Ashish Sood said the move aims to ensure fairness and fill long-pending vacancies in schools and departments. New exam dates will be announced after age relaxation is finalised.

title: 'Grateful forever': Spinner who got Kohli‚Äôs wicket shares emotional post
content: Virat Kohli played a strong innings of 77 for Delhi against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Gujarat spinner Vishal Jayswal took Kohli's wicket. After the match, Jayswal shared a memorable moment with Kohli, receiving an autograph and a photograph. Kohli had previously scored 131 in the tournament. He is not expected to play further matches.

title: New FDNY chief: Musk says people will die because of Mamdani‚Äôs choice; Sacks replies
content: Elon Musk has sparked controversy by warning that New York City's new Fire Department Commissioner, Lillian Bonsignore, lacks the necessary firefighting experience, predicting fatal consequences.  Bonsignore, a 31-year EMS veteran, is defended by Mayor-elect Mamdani, who highlights EMS's growing role and the Commissioner's managerial focus. Tech figures like David Sacks have echoed Musk's concerns.

title: Mikel Arteta & Lorena Bernal net worth 2025: Manager salary, media, investments
content: Mikel Arteta's journey from Premier League player to Arsenal head coach has yielded significant financial rewards, with his $25 million net worth primarily from his managerial salary and bonuses. His wife, Lorena Bernal, a former Miss Spain and actress, contributes an estimated $5-$10 million to their combined wealth of $30-$35 million through her diverse career and investments.

title: 'Anti-India global conspiracy': BJP targets Rahul's Germany trip; flags Pitroda's remark
content: The BJP has accused the Congress of colluding with "anti-India" forces, citing Rahul Gandhi's participation in the "Global Progressive Alliance" during his Germany visit. Citing Sam Pitroda, the BJP claims this alliance promotes "anti-India" narratives and is linked to George Soros, questioning the Congress's association with such global networks.

title: Brittany Mahomes shifts focus as Patrick Mahomes earns praise off the field
content: NFL titans Robert Kraft and Gayle Benson, both billionaires, showcase contrasting paths to sports ownership. Kraft built a vast empire through diverse investments before acquiring the Patriots, while Benson inherited and expanded her late husband's franchises, the Saints and Pelicans. Their financial journeys highlight distinct strategies for wealth accumulation and franchise management.

title: Ashes: Stokes labels MCG pitch 'not ideal' despite historic England win
content: "When you go out there and you're faced with those conditions, you've got to crack on and deal with it," Stokes said after England ended a 15-year wait for a Test win on Australian soil. Smith said the pitch had too much grass, which created excessive seam movement and made batting difficult.

title: Pushpa 2 stampede case: Allu Arjun charged with abetment; 22 others named in chargesheet
content: Nearly a year after a fatal stampede at a Pushpa 2 event, Hyderabad police have filed a chargesheet naming actor Allu Arjun as an accused. The incident, which resulted in a woman's death and her son's severe injury, is attributed to the actor's sudden arrival causing a massive fan rush.

title: Shimla hospital assault: Himachal medical services hit as doctors go on strike
content: Resident doctors in Himachal Pradesh have launched an indefinite strike, halting non-emergency medical services across government hospitals. The protest follows the termination of a doctor accused of assaulting a patient, leading to significant hardship for patients, especially those from remote areas. Medical bodies are backing the doctor, demanding his reinstatement and a fair inquiry.

title: 'Battle of Galwan' teaser: Salman Khan's moving monologue gives pure goosebumps - watch
content: To celebrate his 60th birthday, Salman Khan unveiled the intense teaser for Battle of Galwan. Directed by Apoorva Lakhia, the war epic features Khan as Colonel Santosh Babu.  The 1.12 minute long teaser shows Salman Khan riling up the soldiers of his regiment ahead of an epic battle with the Chinese troops.

title: 15-year wait over! England beat Australia in chaotic fourth Test at MCG
content: England secured a crucial four-wicket victory in the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, marking their first win on Australian soil in 15 years. The match concluded within two days, with England chasing down a target of 175 to restore pride and build confidence for the final Test.

title: This day, that year: Dec 27, 1911 ‚Äî When ‚ÄòJana Gana Mana‚Äô was sung in Calcutta
content: Rabindranath Tagore's patriotic song, 'Jana Gana Mana' was sung publicly for the first time at a 1911 Congress session. It ultimately evolved into becoming India's National Anthem. Initially met with controversy regarding its inspiration, Tagore clarified it honored a timeless guiding spirit, not a monarch. Adopted in 1950 as the national anthem, "Jana Gana Mana" became a unifying national voice.

title: 'We are not into bulldozers': DKS vs Vijayan over demolition drive
content: Karnataka deputy chief minister DK Shivakumar has criticized Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan's remarks on a recent Bengaluru demolition drive. Shivakumar stated that senior leaders should understand ground realities before commenting, emphasizing the action was to protect public land from encroachers and land mafia, not targeting any community. He urged Vijayan to avoid making statements without full knowledge of the situation.

title: Astronomers spot wobbling jets on rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS
content: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is revealing surprising details about its journey. Scientists observed unusual, wobbling jet-like features in its sun-facing anti-tail, suggesting a rotation period of about 15.5 hours. This offers a rare glimpse into the behaviour of a pristine object from another star system reacting to solar heat for the first time, aiding our understanding of planetary formation elsewhere.

title: Israel approves, US does not: Why Somaliland recognition has triggered backlash
content: Israel's recognition of Somaliland as an independent state has sparked significant diplomatic backlash across Africa and the Middle East. This move reopens the debate over the de facto state, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991 and has its own government and institutions but lacks international recognition.

title: FaZe Clan faces major shake-up as five top streamers announce exits
content: Several well-known Twitch streamers have officially left FaZe Clan. The announcements were made on December 25, 2025. Along with Stable Ronaldo, four other members confirmed they were no longer part of FaZe Clan. Rani ‚ÄúStable Ronaldo‚Äù was the first to confirm his exit through a post on X. Soon after, other members followed with similar messages. Their announcements were brief but emotional in tone.

title: Delhi homicide: Man kills wife for refusing to give Rs 20; later dies by suicide
content: A Delhi man allegedly strangled his wife during a dispute over a small sum of money before taking his own life by jumping in front of a train. Police initially faced conflicting accounts from the family, but an autopsy confirmed homicide. Investigations are ongoing into the husband's potential addiction and state of mind.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 23: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna film continues to dominate
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance in its fourth week, outperforming new releases like 'Avatar Fire And Ash' and 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. The film's organic success, driven by genuine audience demand and premium pricing, is setting new records and signaling a shift in industry strategies.

title: Drishyam 3 producer on Akshaye Khanna exit: ‚ÄòLegal notice sent‚Äô
content: Producer Kumar Mangat Pathak revealed Akshaye Khanna's exit from 'Drishyam 3' stemmed from a wig demand and a belief that his film 'Dhurandhar' succeeded solely due to him. Pathak refuted this, citing Khanna's past reliance on ensemble films and his unprofessional behavior, leading to legal action and Jaideep Ahlawat's reported replacement.

title: 'That Indian side wasn't great': Alastair Cook's brutal take on England's 2-2 series draw
content: Alastair Cook believes England's 2-2 draw against India, led by Shubman Gill, was against a "not a great Indian side." He expressed concern that this result masked underlying issues and potentially diverted focus from crucial series like the Ashes, where England are currently trailing Australia 0-3.

title: ‚ÄòOperation Aaghat 3.0‚Äô: Delhi Police arrest over 200 ahead of New Year, seize illegal weapons
content: Delhi Police conducted a massive overnight crackdown, detaining over 1,300 individuals to ensure a crime-free New Year. 'Operation Aaghat 3.0' saw hundreds arrested for various offenses, including arms and drug violations, while others were held preventively. Significant seizures of weapons, liquor, and stolen goods were made, bolstering city security.

title: Russia strikes Kyiv with missiles, drones; message for Trump ahead of Zelenskyy meet?
content: Kyiv was rocked by powerful explosions early Saturday as Russia launched missile and drone attacks across Ukraine. Air defenses were active, with authorities urging residents to seek shelter. This latest assault occurs as President Zelenskyy prepares to meet with US President Donald Trump to discuss a peace proposal aimed at ending the ongoing conflict.

title: Railway Budget 2026: Funding for Indian Railways likely to remain unchanged
content: Indian Railways' Gross Budgetary Support (GBS) for FY26-27 is expected to remain stable, with current allocations sufficient for infrastructure upgrades. While overall GBS may be steady, internal allocations will be rejigged to prioritize projects like the bullet train, track safety, and decongestion initiatives.

title: 'Forced to spend Rs 40 lakh on reception': Newlywed woman dies by suicide in Bengaluru
content: A 26-year-old newlywed woman, Ganavi, died after allegedly attempting suicide, with her family accusing her husband and his relatives of dowry harassment. The family staged a protest at the husband's home after her death, demanding the arrest of his family members. Police have registered a dowry death case and are searching for the absconding accused.

title: MEA says will bring back all ‚Äòfugitives‚Äô after Lalit Modi mocks govt
content: India is determined to bring back all fugitives wanted for prosecution. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal confirmed ongoing talks with multiple governments for extradition. Delays in cases like Vijay Mallya and Lalit Modi are due to complex legalities. India remains committed to ensuring these individuals face trial in Indian courts.

title: UPSC examination calendar 2026: Stay ready and check NDA, CDS, Civil Services dates here
content: The UPSC Examination Calendar 2026 is now available for aspirants to plan their preparation effectively. With exams like Civil Services, NDA, CDS, Engineering Services, CAPF, and IFS scheduled throughout the year, candidates can align their study schedule, revision, and mock tests accordingly. This detailed calendar includes notification dates, application deadlines, exam commencement dates, and duration for all major examinations and recruitment tests, helping candidates stay organized, focused, and fully prepared for success in 2026.

content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . the unofficial kick off to trade season happened on Dec. 15, with nearly 90% of players becoming eligible to be moved -- it'll get only hotter from here .

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Can anyone stop Bayern or Arsenal?
content: midfielder and striker has made the best start to the 2025-26 season . this is the festive season, which means it's time for most major european leagues to give teams a little bit of a break . top 20 teams in the big five leagues in what we'll call "adjusted goal differential"

title: 36 NFL rookies reveal the one big lesson they learned this season
content: rookie safety malaki Starks explains the biggest lesson he has learned from his debut season . the rookie missed time during training camp with a groin injury . he spent most of the first quarter of the season on the scout team .

title: Can Jalen Hurts or Josh Allen break the career rushing TD record?
content: the Philadelphia Eagles host the Buffalo Bills at the etihad stadium on tuesday . the game features two of the most prolific rushing quarterbacks of all time . if their bodies cooperate and the stars align, what they're capable of achieving would be epic .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: One stat that will make or break 2026 for all 15 NL teams
content: we're going to pick one stat from the 2025 season for each MLB team . we'll start with the national league and then return with the American League . 17 different pitchers recorded a save for the Diamondbacks .

title: 'If I don‚Äôt get this right, my career is over': How Penn State landed on Matt Campbell as its next coach
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: How the Texans built one of the best defenses in the NFL
content: deMeco Ryans says he's sitting here with the overwhelming feeling like, what are we doing . he knew his defense needed help on the edge to thrive . the Texans had the no. 2 pick, but it was also in need of a franchise quarterback .

title: Why Laveranues Coles decided to give up his cushy retired life to become an officer
content: officer laveranues Coles was approached by an elderly woman, a shopper walking to her car . she saw a police officer with a handgun, taser and a tactical vest that included a body cam, pepper spray, handcuffs and police radio . he was sexually abused as a child by his gun-wielding stepfather .

title: Aaron Rodgers, Baker Mayfield among players chasing millions in bonuses
content: Aaron Rodgers could make more than his base salary in bonuses this season . if the Steelers make the playoffs, Rodger would make an extra $500,000. A Pittsburgh wild-card win would earn him another $600,000 . the money only grows as the stakes get higher .

title: Michigan hires Whittingham as HC on 5-year deal
content: "sportsCenter" weighs in on hiring Kyle Whittingham as its next head coach . the deal at Michigan averages $8.2 million per year, sources tell ESPN's Pete Thamel and Dan Wetzel . 66-year-old told his Utah team that he will not coach in the SRS distribution Las Vegas Bowl .
